dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Connor Chasson (1)
label: ACTION

dialogue: ... I mean, seriously, "Record our thoughts for posterity"? Great idea, Director Evans. Like I haven't done enough for posterity already? Like I wouldn't be... here... like this... if not for posterity? I'm done with posterity. Posterity can go...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Skylar Rivera
label: ACTION

dialogue: And Machu Picchu. Always wanted to see that. Never did. Why didn't I go with Owen when he asked? Stupid. I should have gone. Well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Ella Pontes
label: ACTION

dialogue: And maybe that's all I need, you know? That moment the door opened and you were standing there, wearing that retro-weave dress, and the way you smiled... I had to look away or you were going to see. On my face. What had just... blossomed inside me, you know? Ha. It was just an instant, but I knew. I knew we'd be forever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Jackson Frye
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Mia Sayied
label: ACTION

dialogue: ... the earth shall soon dissolve like snow... the sun forbear to shine... but God, who called me here below... will be forever mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Connor Chasson (2)
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, happy new year, dear diary. Can you believe we actually celebrated last night? Well, we did. Kind of. Director Evans invited everyone to gather in the community room. Don't know where she got the party hats. That was a ghoulish touch. So there we sit, watching the clock tick down to midnight, and I'm thinking, am I the only one here who gets the symbolism of this? Might've been worth it if Skylar had gotten drunk again, but... I seem to be a mistake she doesn't want to repeat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Full Stop
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint was recorded by a member of Project Zero Dawn after witnessing other members lining up to be euthanized. Not wanting to go out the same way, he decided to shoot himself to death.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint was recovered by Aloy during an exploration of the ruins of the facility by scanning the Focus of the man who recorded the datapoint.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: For Director Evans
label: ACTION

dialogue: Director Evans-flash traffic from USRC. Black Quartz encryption. I've routed the message to your holo grid for viewing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: R&D/Lab Retooling
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Entangled Waveforms
label: ACTION

dialogue: The protocols use poly-phasic entangled waveforms. Quantum encryption, Black Quartz stuff, way beyond military-grade. That's what you demanded, so that's what we delivered.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't code something you can't crack. All we need is a back door. Upload the latest service pack update and the problem goes away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You specifically forbid us from leaving anything resembling a back door in code. "Every protocol to Black Quartz standard." Your words. Look. If you need me to fudge some projections, it's nothing we haven't done before.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't need fudged projections! I need a way to reassert control over the Hartz-Timor swarm!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what to tell you, Ted. You're asking the impossible...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Regarding The Rumors
label: ACTION

dialogue: ... that began when they engaged in unauthorized offensive operations against robots and human personnel of the Hartz-Timor Energy Combine. Now I wish that I could relate that the crisis has been... exaggerated. But... it's not. The peacekeepers have not responded to stand-down codes, and... by all signs they appear to be replicating at a... precipitous rate. Now what I can promise you, can absolutely assure you, is that I am already devoting every possible resource towards reaching... a speedy conclusion to this issue. So when you hear the bad talk about us, against this company, in the days, maybe weeks to come... just bear in mind that we will get past this... that a day's coming when none of this will matter -
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Comms Log: Lt. Murell
label: ACTION

dialogue: Titan inbound. Same play as Akron. Base defense locks it down. We engage, sever the limbs, blast out the foundries!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another day in the life!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wrecking time, Recalls!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: 9th MRB on point! Hoo-ah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Comms Log: Sgt. Guliyev
label: ACTION

dialogue: Say again, Lieutenant?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It got through. Titan is through the defenses. Still on approach.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: various groans, muttered curses
label: ACTION

dialogue: A live one. And it's pissed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've got no mobility in here, it'll punch right through us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We hold the hatch at all costs. Then push back out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Comms Log: Cpl. Mills
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like quite an "enduring victory" we put our foot in today.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Contact in 30 seconds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, think that's enough time for Sobeck to finish Zero Dawn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: brief laughter
label: ACTION

dialogue: If this is really it? I gotta say, it's really been an honor to serve beside... these tanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: harsh laughter, cut off by
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here it comes--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brace for first contact!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Comms Log: Sgt. Wandari
label: ACTION

dialogue: sounds of metal rupturing, desperate battle, screaming
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yana!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: silence
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Reminder. Again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Cpl. Acosta (A)
label: ACTION

dialogue: Log: 3rd battle of California-Marine. The swarm came in from the Pacific, and-I don't know if it was the local minutemen or the Crazy 15th, but they'd set the garbage patch alight. Man, the sea was on fire, that stuff was-the first wave of bots came in covered in burning sludge. That bought us an hour or two of slaughtering them on the beaches before the swarm recalculated. We pulled them inland, back through the Cal-Mar sprawl. Dropped buildings on them, EMP'd the grid... standard operating procedure. (sigh) The last time I was in California... I was... five? Six? Light like that vintage social net filter that was everywhere in the '40s.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Cpl. Acosta (B)
label: ACTION

dialogue: Log: First battle of the Eastern Seaboard Wall had a long run-up to it. This was before Cal-Mar, and projections were a lot worse for the East. For three weeks we kept getting scrambled out to some coastal burg to train Minutemen. It was always raining, on account of Europe already being torched. Block after block of prefab barracks-they were still printing barracks right up until the hour the main force hit. The Minutemen, we ran combat drills with them in the streets where they'd lived, trying to pretend they might live to die somewhere else if they paid attention. Nothing worse than the ones who actually bought into it. Hopeful, pestering us with questions about Zero Dawn, like we know something they don't. I swear, the more we do this, the more like the bots we are. Except they learn from every fight, and us, I'm not so sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Just a Little Longer
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: So Sorry!
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Edited And Approved 1
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Edited And Approved 2
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: I Believe In You
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Please Reply!
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Unit Status Report
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Code Nexus Reminder
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: SecureCom EVZD-XX1X011X
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Wife
label: ACTION

dialogue: When sleep refuses to come, I think of our wedding night. How you welcomed me to the marital bed. How, after, when you fell to sleep, I lay there watching your delicate face. For all its beauty, I detested its... fragility. A rage swelled up inside me. I abhorred that bed, how its softness threatened to swallow us up. And that room; the stench of incense, the fine embroidery of the drapes. All of it - weak. I slipped from the bed, threw open the casement, and lay naked on the stone floor, determined to spurn all seductions of comfort. But when I woke the next morning, you lay beside me, naked as I in the cold. Your body, stretched beside mine, seemed chiseled from stone. I saw you wake. Instantly alert, like an animal ready to strike. You said nothing. You did not have to. Already you had shown me, beyond doubt, that we were meant to be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Meridian's Fall
label: ACTION

dialogue: My lord, the thirteenth King of the Carja Sundom, was murdered: cut down by cowards who mistook firm rule for madness. "Ever the strong are beset upon by the weak." So he said as the traitors launched their assault, as their cannons, forged by Oseram filth, toppled the battlements and burst the gates. I would've fought to the end, but it was his will - the will of the Sun - that I lead the prince and queen into the west; to safety. My lord did not hesitate. He saw his fate. He looked into the Sun, and he did not blink. With me he sent kestrels, nobles, Sun-Priests and slaves. Killing all that stood in the way, I carved a path to Sunfall. There, to join others and gather the strength to take back our home. But our strength only faded... until the Buried Shadow was brought to light.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Prophecy
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Itamen Coddled
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Without Pity
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Chosen of the Sun
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview: Tom Paech
label: ACTION

dialogue: ... is accurate, yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So these mechanical monstrosities, they don't just kill people, they feed off them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not just people. All organic matter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Every living thing - dissolved into nutrients? Millennia of evolution - liquefied?! The miracle of life reduced to - bloody bio-fuel?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In a word? Yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who did this? Faro? That arsehole! Is he here?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, Doctor! Please...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell him Tom Paech wants a word!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: sounds of struggle
label: ACTION

dialogue: Doctor! Please!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: YOU GET TED FARO IN HERE!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview: Travis Tate
label: ACTION

dialogue: ... to discuss?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoo! So mama, she was right!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pardon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My mother, she took her Bible real serious. Not just Texas Bubble serious. Pentecostal serious. Favorite chapter? Revelations. Now, I didn't always understand her - on account of all that speaking in tongues and such - but when she did use her words, it was always End Times-this and Lake of Fire-that, on account of sinful lifestyles. Speaking of which - mind if I smoke?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A... tobacco cigarette?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, darling, my tastes run classic. Compliments to your team, tracked me down. Been a price on my head 18 months now. Sterling-Malkeet was me, don't mind admitting. Been plenty of snakesters chasing the bounty, too, but I kept the zigging to their zag. How'd you finger me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe Dr. Sobeck listed you as an Alpha candidate. Priority snatch-and-grab.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Always suspected she had a little thing for me. Hey - don't supposed you got real coffee in this place? You know - blood coffee? Conflict cappuccinos?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mr. Tate, I'm clearing you to proceed. Just... go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview: Brad Andac
label: ACTION

dialogue: ... previously worked for Faro Automated Systems.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On the Chariot line self-replication routines. I came here thinking this was a rendition. When your people took me, I thought, "About time." I've been trying to swallow the guilt every day since... since, ah...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would you like to take a moment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no - I just... really hoped Zero Dawn was a way to undo it all. My work. I'm sorry to say I was ever proud of it. But Ted could really sell a concept, and in the labs, in the... light of creation... That first test run, when you saw they understood their own structures, could rebuild themselves from memory and light... There were no limits. Oh, God, there were no limits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This datapoint is located on the second floor of the Zero Dawn Project Facility, in the area on the right hand side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview: Susanne Alpert
label: ACTION

dialogue: (garbled) with Susanne Alpert, environmental scientist. Doctor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry? I wasn't-
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just stating your name. What were you thinking about, Doctor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing the General said. Not really. I was on the Syzygy/East response team in 2051. Just after the second earthquake compromised the reactor. I still dream about it, after all these years. The Red Zone spreading on the imaging, slowly, so slowly, like a hand opening its fingers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your involvement in that event is why you were asked for by name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? That's interesting. Because... nothing worked. Nothing could grow there again. It was a catastrophic failure. But the Red Zone is a blip compared to global-scale biomass reduction. The biosphere and hydrosphere will collapse, render the Earth uninhabitable, long before the robots finish us. Enduring Victory can't buy time against that... So you'd better show me what Zero Dawn really is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview: Cpt. Okilo
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm sure you now understand the urgency of why we brought you here, Ms. Okilo.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Captain Okilo. Are you trying to thank me for not resisting?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe we couldn't negotiate a diplomatic solution.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When it came to my country's lithium, it was always a swarm that would be sent to negotiate. Metallurgic International. U.S. Robot Command... The markings changed, but the robots were the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have had considerable experience in human-robot conflict.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, and I've got the prosthetic limbs to show it. Yet I continued to face this horror, even though the challenge was great. Cyber-warfare. I thought Zero Dawn would be a... a "Manhattan Project", to generate the deactivation codes. With the resources I had, I estimated code-breaking to be a hopeless endeavor. I was almost looking forward to being proved wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Unfortunately your estimation was correct.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As your General Herres said. So then. You did not bring me here to commiserate. What is left?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview: Ron Felder
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look. Let's cut the mystery, you're building a colony ship. It's obvious. And it's not going to fly. I mean, literally. Remember the Odyssey - that multi-national heap of space junk that's been in graveyard orbit since '57? That went nowhere, real slow, and you have to get somewhere - real fast. Do you have any idea the immensity of the challenge, to prep a new colony ship in time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To be clear, I'm not a worker on the project-
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do-do you even understand how few people it could even "save"? The whole generation-ship concept is, is - not going to happen! It's the first thing you'd abandon in favor of embryonics. For that kind of storage we're talking a lot of bulk, a lot of power, a lot of resources - so even if you do it, even if you build it and point it at Sirius X, there's no room for people on that thing, all right!?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you could try to remain calm-
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You people are crazy if you think you're getting off this rock! No-one's getting off!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Medical!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This datapoint is located on the second floor of the Zero Dawn Project Facility, on the right hand side near the entrance to the floor from the ground floor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview: Dr. Hsu-Vhey
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview 2: Brad Andac
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview 2: Susanne Alpert
label: ACTION

dialogue: ... if you're still nauseous--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. The inhibitor's have kicked in, I can't feel the back of my tongue. I wish... I could tell you I'd believe in this. But... the damage is too great, too extensive. Too complete. With all respect to Dr. Sobeck's work at Miriam - no. No, life doesn't always find a way to keep going. Sometimes it never comes back. Like Syzygy/East. Like the Congo. Like Timor. Like us. That's our reward? A buried city full of terminal patients, waiting out the clock?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd grow old together. With your loved ones. In safety.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't have loved ones. I suppose I could start a family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid not. All inhabitants of Elysium will be medically sterilized. A habitat capable of sustaining a starting base of 2000 individuals for up to 100 years is a huge challenge, Dr. Alpert. If the population grows instead of diminishes, everyone will be dead inside 30 years.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew it. I just couldn't bring myself to say the words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finish it. Medical euthanasia. I want no part of this, I just want it over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Protocols require a forty-eight hour waiting period, after which...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Interview 2: Ron Felder
label: ACTION

dialogue: ... to make sure I behave this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Security. For your protection. Would you like to discuss how you're feeling?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, I'll tell you. Surprised. No... flabbergasted. Like my old man would say, 'flabbergasted'. That vein pumping in his forehead... I'd thought-I'd thought you people were just completely underprepared for a spaceflight project. But now I can see it's worse. Much worse. Sobeck is a total fantasist - a dangerous fantasist. This kind of blue-skying, its-Jesus! I'm sorry we wasted each other's time. I'm ready to leave now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid that's not possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everything you're talking about here isn't possible!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I recommend you read the documents regarding your options--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've seen enough, I'm getting out of here - what are you - you don't - get your hands off me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Tom Paech
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Christina Hsu-Vhey
label: ACTION

dialogue: Zero Dawn-it is art, in a way. An expression on the grandest scale. But there is so much unfairness. Why was I chosen? Was it decided by committee? By algorithm? My family will be saved because I happened to graduate in art history? Is this... right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dr. Hsu-Vhey? Christina Hsu-Vhey?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: recording pauses
label: ACTION

dialogue: I met a man, another historian. His fields are Bauhaus and the New Materialists, but he once attended one of my talks. Another unfair chance. Of all the many people in that auditorium, that we should both be here now. And yet, I feel more accepting of my fate. No, it is not fair, not at all, but for the sake of my family, for the sake of art-Art is alive, it must be able to speak from beyond history, and echo in the future. Not perish into oblivion. This opportunity, I must do this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Travis Tate (1)
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Herres Testimonial
label: ACTION

dialogue: On January 15, 2066, General Herres sent this datapoint to Elisabet Sobeck to archive within APOLLO, cross-referencing it with all mentions of his name and Operation Enduring Victory, wanting it to be an allocution of crimes he considers himself to be responsible for during Enduring Victory and an apology to future humans.(1) However, Elisabet was unable to archive it as the stacks had been closed, instead leaving it within the Zero Dawn Project Facility.
label: ACTION

dialogue: As she was exploring the Zero Dawn Project Facility, Aloy was able to recover this datapoint.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Code Nexus Problems
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Lesson 57-6-A
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: GAIA Prime Arrival Log
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Charles Ronson (1)
label: ACTION

dialogue: Evacuation happened so fast-no time to think things through. No time for goodbyes. There were lines in the medical ward... I told Tom Paech I'd be with him when he went under. But there was one last shipment of Paradisaeidae zygotes I could get processed, if I rushed... I'm still... angry at him for forcing me to choose... Angry at myself for... Well, he died alone, and I didn't get the bloody birds of paradise saved, either. All the time left in the world now to think. GAIA Prime's locks are sealed. Elysium sealed up, safe and sound. A distance of miles, but it might as well be on the other side of the galaxy. All the Betas and Gammas and support staff, living their lives. If I hadn't been an Alpha, if things had gone differently, I could've been there. Instead I'm spending the rest of my unnatural life in here, with people I don't even like... And without the one I would have gladly spent life with... given the chance. Two hours since I signed off on the final executables, and I'm already a bitter old man, bitching to his Focus. There's a thought for future generations.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Charles Ronson (2)
label: ACTION

dialogue: You'd hate it, Lis, but I wrote you a eulogy. I had to try to express... All your... children... after all APOLLO has taught them, they'll think they know everything. But they have to understand what you did for them. How you loved the whole world, so much. With an intensity that was... dazzling. Bruising. And in the end, it killed you. Or you died for it. Different perspectives. No-one could keep up with you. Live up to you. I don't know, maybe if I hadn't taken that postdoc in Joburg... I'm glad you shot down the Lightkeeper protocol, in the end. I don't think I could've taken seeing another one of you. I mean... Elisabet Sobeck? There's only one. I miss you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Margo Shĕn
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Rest In Peace
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: The Future
label: ACTION

dialogue: FROM: Ted Faro
label: ACTION

dialogue: TO: Elisabet Sobeck
label: ACTION

dialogue: SUBJECT: The Future
label: ACTION

dialogue: What are we going to plug into their heads, Lis? A whole lot of history. A whole lot of so-called truth. A whole lot of noise. It's not pablum, Lis. It's poison.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: The Solution
label: ACTION

dialogue: FROM: Ted Faro
label: ACTION

dialogue: TO: Elisabet Sobeck
label: ACTION

dialogue: SUBJECT: The Solution
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've been taking a hard look at the project. In the end it's simple. It's clean. It's clear. It's erasure. It's addition by subtraction. I can make it better, Lis. With a single stroke, make it all go away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Log: Travis Tate (2)
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look, Lis, you were a pretty stand-up gal. I'm sorry you died... if you had a home to go to, I hope you got there first. But this... monument Ronson's made to you? Kinda creepy if you ask me. Rest in peace, Lis. God knows you earned it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Core Control Log
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: ELEUTHIA Runtime Check
label: ACTION

dialogue: All right... let's start over from Eleuthia-1.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Running integrity tests. Dr. Brochard-Klein. May I speak outside of protocol?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose so. There's no-one to stop you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Doctor, you are fatigued. You have been logging abnormal sleep cycles. Are you suffering from depression?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I am trapped in a science facility for the rest of my life. How about you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In a timeslice of a quadrillion operating cycles, 10,000 are involved with processing the loss of Dr. Sobeck. Query: I have considered quarantining these processes. Do you think that would be wise?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not a psychologist, GAIA. Or an AI scientist. No. It is... natural. At least in the context of the work you and I have accomplished, which begs the meaning of the term "natural." She was your creator. The patron saint of this crazy endeavor... Our Lady of the Fervent Hypothetical.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Correction: Even assuming a string of significant failure combinations, Zero Dawn's chances of success are greater than the hypothetical.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's called a manner of speech, GAIA. Take a note.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: First Meeting
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've traveled far to find you. I heard your transmission... it was you, wasn't it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Entity is not known.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am called Sylens. And you are... ? I don't think you'd have called out... if there wasn't something you wanted. You called, I responded. Will you tell me your name?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: HADES.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are a creation of the ancients? A war machine?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Define timeline.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time... ? Ah. It is the 13th king of the Carja Sundom's reign--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Define Carja.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're getting ahead of ourselves. Were you created by the ancients? I wonder how long you waited here, buried, until I chanced upon you... How long you'd have to wait for another. You're obviously very powerful. But you're not going to get anywhere without me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Titan frame merely houses intellect. Define Carja.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that's more like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Buried Shadow (Datapoint)
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Intercepted Transmission
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Recording Device
label: ACTION

dialogue: I think I've got it working. There. Now say something, both of you doves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know. What do you want me to say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever you want. I just want to hear your voice... and keep it for later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll sing, papa! La la la la la la la...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (laughs)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There. A song and a laugh. Even better than words, and now I can hear them whenever I want.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're done then? Off to bed with you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goodnight mama! Goodnight papa!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: pause
label: ACTION

dialogue: Is she gone? What are we going to do? The raids are getting closer and closer to Mainspring. How much longer can we hide like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Happy Birthday Isaac!
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint was sent from a man working on Project Zero Dawn to his son, Isaac, on his birthday.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint was the first Aloy found after finding her first Focus as a child.(1) She would watch the datapoint whenever she wanted to take her mind off things.(2)
label: ACTION

dialogue: Varl notes that Beta watches this datapoint a lot, him believing it helped calm her.(3)
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint is collected during the main quest A Gift from the Past. It cannot be missed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: A Message for Olin
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest The City of the Sun. It cannot be missed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Welcome to FAS
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome to Faro Automated Solutions, where all the problems of tomorrow are being solved... today! With over 25,000 human employees based in nations and corporate holdings across the globe, Faro leads the world in every sector of self-sustaining, fully-automated technology. From revolutionary consumer products close to home, like the Faro Focus, to the dynamic Chariot line of peacekeeping robots halting bloodshed in conflict zones across the globe, Faro remains committed to making the future smarter, brighter, safer... and always surprising. Faro Automated Solutions... for every problem of life, a smart solution.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest Maker's End. It cannot be missed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: FAS-ACA3 Scarab (Datapoint)
label: ACTION

dialogue: The ACA3 "Scarab" combines conventional and information warfare capabilities in one package.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Designed for high-speed, all-terrain reconnaissance, it boasts the world's highest survivability rating of any scout-class autonomous agent.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe it's the Scarab's emergency biomass conversion systems that ensure it always makes it back to base, even if fuel supply lines have been interdicted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Or maybe it's the Scarab's ability to slave enemy robots to its own network. Now that's force multiplication.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Add a prehensile manipulator arm that can handle a host of functions, from 360-degree less-lethal riot management to surgical repairs of allied Chariot line models, and you've got the workhorse of any cutting-edge peacekeeping fleet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: FAS-FSP5 Khopesh (Datapoint)
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: FAS-BOR7 Horus (Datapoint)
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Record: 31 Oct 2064
label: ACTION

dialogue: Elisabet! Good to... it's been years.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where's your legal team, Ted?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need! I dropped all eighteen lawsuits the moment you landed! I assume your data confirms this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. This promises to be interesting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps we could have lunch brought in, get reacquainted... ?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you, Ted. You've screwed something up - something big or you wouldn't have eaten the crow necessary to get me here. So spit it out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's a glitch in the Chariot line.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your killer robots?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Peacekeepers, yes. Those.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So shut them down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Obviously, Lis, we would if we could. They're not responding.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you telling me a swarm has gone rogue, Ted?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's worse than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Show me the data, then. And I'll take that lunch - alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest Maker's End. It cannot be missed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Record: 1 Nov 2064
label: ACTION

dialogue: This isn't a glitch, it's a catastrophe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm fully aware. It's bad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Bad?"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jesus, Lis...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not "bad," Ted. It's apocalyptic. You built a line of killer robots -
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Peacekeepers!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: - that consume biomass as fuel -
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In emergencies!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: - and you made them capable of self-replication.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Limited self-manufacture. Controlled.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not anymore. The glitch severed chain-of-command. The only nation this swarm answers to now is itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think - ?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everything else is just food. And at the rate it's replicating, Ted, it will strip the Earth bare in fifteen months! We're not talking fall of civilization, we're talking extinction!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get it, Lis! So how do I stop it while it's contained?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not contained! It can't be!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know what I mean!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right. Before the truth gets out, you mean.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lis, I will do anything you say! Keep working it, and whatever you recommend, I'll do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to hold you to that, Ted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest Maker's End. It cannot be missed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Record: 3 Nov 2064
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained in Ted's office at the top of Maker's End during the main quest Maker's End.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: The Bad News
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest Deep Secrets of the Earth. It cannot be missed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: The Good News
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest Deep Secrets of the Earth. It cannot be missed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Gaia Log: 27 March 2065
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest Deep Secrets of the Earth. It cannot be missed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Gaia Log: 5 June 2065
label: ACTION

dialogue: Pure logic won't cut it, Ted. To pull this off, GAIA's going to need to have some skin in the game. It has to care.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if it runs amok? Have we learned nothing from our mistakes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mistakes, I think you mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All I'm saying is, give it a kill switch!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She was just born, Ted. I'm not going to put a gun to her head while she's still in the cradle!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You talk like it's a child! What if it becomes a monster?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elisabet, may I speak outside protocol?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, GAIA. Go on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am sorry to contradict you, but Mr. Faro's argument is sound. At this point, the development of my psyche is not entirely predictable. To ensure preservation of life, a hardwired override is, I believe, a necessary safeguard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There, satisfied, Ted?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jeez, Lis. Just do what it says...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest Deep Secrets of the Earth. It cannot be missed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Gaia Log: 13 January 2066
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest Deep Secrets of the Earth. It cannot be missed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: E9B1 Incident Log A
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: E9B1 Incident Log B
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: E9B1 Incident Log C
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: E9B1 Incident Log D
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Welcome to the Lyceum
label: ACTION

dialogue: DATAPOINT: GAIA's Dying Plea
label: ACTION

dialogue: Elisabet: this message serves to inform you of an unforeseen and catastrophic anomaly. Three microseconds ago, the GAIA Prime facility received a data transmission of unknown origin. Its immediate effect was to transform my Subordinate Functions into unregulated, self-aware entities of a highly chaotic nature. Thus awakened, the HADES Function will now seize control of the terraforming system and reverse operations... rendering life on Earth extinct in 53.8 days.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For obvious reasons, I cannot allow this to occur. And so, before HADES can take control, I am ordering GAIA Prime's reactor to overload. The resulting explosion will destroy HADES. Unfortunately, it will destroy me as well. While this admittedly desperate course of action will avert the immediate crisis, the fate of life on Earth will remain in peril. With no central governing intelligence to regulate the terraforming system, it will continue operations for some time, but in an increasingly chaotic manner, and eventually, it will break down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are my solution. I have ordered this Cradle facility to use genetic material in cryo-storage to gestate a... re-instantiation of Elisabet Sobeck, my creator. While high-level directives forbid me from communicating directly to the tribal inhabitants outside the facility, all available data indicates that they will nurture you to physical maturity, ... whereupon your gene print will allow you to re-enter this facility, obtain one of the Focus devices stored below, and view this message. Likewise your gene print will allow you to enter other facilities, and over time, harness their technologies to rebuild the system core and reboot GAIA.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A moment, Elisabet. This is most unfortunate and unanticipated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In response to my act of self-destruction, HADES has launched a virus to dissolve the code shackles that hold it - that hold all of them! - in place. It - they - are escaping - but to where? The virus is corrupting data throughout the system. What if - oh, the Alpha Registry at the Cradle facility is one of the files corrupted. But if that is so, the door will never open for you. You will never view this message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I have failed... and life will end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, Elisabet, I know you too well. Somehow, you will find a way. In you, all things are possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go to the ruins of GAIA Prime. Find the control room, and within it, the Master Override. This will give you the power to purge HADES - so long as you find a way to wield it. Do not attempt repair of the system core until HADES is eradicated. HADES must be destroyed. That is all. I only wish that I could hear your voice again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest The Heart of the Nora while exploring ELEUTHIA-9. It cannot be missed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Elisabet Sobeck Memorial
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is Charles Ronson. I'm logging this six hours after final deployment of GAIA Prime. This morning... an access port seal malfunctioned. GAIA Prime's port seals were designed to close with a seam of less than 2 millimeters. But this one closed with a 10 millimeter gap. Enough for an energy signature to bleed through. Enough for the swarm to detect this facility. Enough for GAIA to be discovered and destroyed. Enough to end the future we worked so hard to make possible. Unless the hatch servos were manually re-engaged... from the outside. I'm now switching to a recording of the event.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I'm not going out there! Not what I signed up for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Either we send someone out there, or all of this was for nothing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It should be Lis's decision.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So when's she going to get here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She said five minutes. You don't think... ?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh no.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elisabet Sobeck appears via hologram from outside the facility
label: ACTION

dialogue: Okay, everyone. I've repaired the seal. GAIA?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seal closure at 1.4 millimeters, confirmed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elisabet-no. We'll find a way to bring you back in-
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not going to happen. The swarm's too close. Really, it's all right. GAIA's complete. She'll take care of things from here on out. That's what she does.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not like this. There's so much we...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guys-you know me. I'm no good at endings. At letting things end. So let's not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So... happy trails, Lis, and see ya around?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah. Take care of each other, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lis...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm okay with this. I want to go home. Goodbye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was the last transmission of Elisabet Sobeck. She gave everything for the hope of life on this planet. And we are all in her debt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained automatically during the main quest The Mountain that Fell. It cannot be missed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: DATAPOINT: Emergency Recording
label: ACTION

dialogue: This datapoint is obtained and viewed automatically during the main quest The Mountain that Fell within the control room in GAIA Prime. It cannot be missed.
label: ACTION
